Oh boy where do I start. Just want to say that I love the calmness of said game, however;
A.) The game is poorly optimized as you can not tab out of said game without it sometimes crashing.
B.) The game in general has had the same repetitive "update" over and over and let's be real here, nothing new is ever added except DLC's, and don't even get me started on the outrageous amount there are for this game.
C.) It's a gamble when you load up certain maps due to the game having memory issues.
D.) The Direct X12 experimental beta is a damn joke due to the game being in such a poor state as is due to it barely being able to run the base game as is.

negative.review: Genuinely the most poorly optimized game out there. I have a pretty decent gaming laptop all things considered, and it can handle a lot of poorly optimized games, but THIS ANCIENT GAME, that is only a year younger than I am, is the most unstable, poorly optimized game I've ever played. Even on DX12 with the lowest graphics settings possible, I was getting CONSTANT out-of-memory crashes. I don't know how you guys at Dovetail sleep at night knowing that you keep pushing this 16-year-old sloppily optimized crash-fest of a game like it's one of the greatest things since sliced bread.
No Raildriver support - 3rd party tools for it dont work well either - DLC for this dont work with any of the other Train Sim version just a heads up

I just can't get behind this sim. Environments look terrible, controls are not very realistic, models are subpar at best. I really don't understand the hype behind this series of sims. Hell, this is the same game as TSW6, and it's the same game as whatever Dovetail put out ten years ago, just repackaged and rebadged.

Too difficult to get running. Computer displays difficult to understand reasons why nothing works, uses too much computer jargon instead of giving instructions in plain English as to what the purchaser should do. For example, tried to start the game this morning, it stopped while trying to "launch", What does that mean ? Then it stopped and displayed "corrupt download". Only that worked was to "uninstall it" which I think means remove it from the computer. Then I had to "download" it, would not do that because "download queue". What does that mean ?
not much to do without spending a fortune on DLC

Aside from that, the game looks dated, yet stutters a lot on the first run.

I thought the game was relatively cheap just because it is just dated, hoping there is decent amount of content in there. Turns out that's not the case. If you just want to try it anyway, I'd suggest trying the subscription plan instead, at least those have more content, and then buy the full game if you like it.
